definition[0]: to help someone to live a healthy, useful, or active life again after they have been seriously ill or in prison
example[0]: a special unit for rehabilitating stroke patients
definition[1]: to make people think that someone or something is good again after a period when people had a bad opinion of them
example[1]: The prime minister seems to be trying to rehabilitate the former defence secretary.
definition[2]: to improve a building or area so that it returns to the good condition it was in before
example[2]: A lot of the older houses have now been rehabilitated.
